data.title: American Food
data.text: This Family Restaurant's one of the best home made food , steak and eggs  with hash brown  pancakes  pork chops  grits  homemade potato  great tasting coffee  the waitress  they're awesome people Place if you're in Lancaster stop by for breakfast lunch it's a very good place to eat every time I go to Lancaster I stop by to eat thank you an awesome breakfast

data.title: Great food great service
data.text: Just had one of my many Business breakfasts at AM Café.  Great food and great service.  Had the corned beef hash with 3 eggs poached and ordered medium poached, still runny, w/ biscuits and gravy.  Eggs were perfect, hash was hot but not burnt and biscuits and gravy were almost too hot to eat for the first 5 minutes.  Companion had the 2 pork chops and eggs done perfectly.  This is my go to place for breakfast both business and pleasure.

data.title: excellent
data.text: This Place is a awesome, this Place to get a Really outstanding meal but the price is a tiny bit high but you get more food then you think and the service is outstanding also.

data.title: Good atmosphere
data.text: Good food and help was friendly and helpful.  Pancakes are the main staple and the rest of the menu is very good also.

data.title: Yummy! Homey atmosphere!
data.text:
My family comes here often.  We have been customers for over 8 years and the staff are welcoming and kind. 
Food is fantastic!  I love the banana walnut pancakes and banana french toast! My kids love the burritos,  crepes and chocolate pancakes!  Great coffee!  They get busy so sometimes it takes a little bit to get your food. But it well worth it!

data.title: Great breakfast
data.text: This place has some of the best pancakes and french toast around. The staff is super friendly and the food is great. If you need a breakfast spot, this is the place to go.

data.title: Homey & Delicious
data.text: By far the best breakfast in town. The menu range is truly vast. Four long full pages. Come again for lunch and you will be pleased once more. Home style cooking. Fresh and prepared just the way you like it. Whatever you order will be a plate full. Add to this the warm friendly waitress's, and you have yourself a great eating experience.

data.title: Homestyle feel
data.text:
Had a break in between work nearby so I stopped here for breakfast at lunch.  Entered the room (fortunately through the LEFT door) and was greeted by colorful farmstyle décor & a friendly waitress.  Once again, I noticed that she was much more friendly with the regulars however.  Not as bad as prior experiences for an out-of-towner like me though.

Anyway, I ordered the caramel apple pancakes with all the sides.  I appreciated the hand-cut potatoes.  My scrambled eggs were very good.  Pancakes & bacon was also great.  My only negative is that the caramel apples (think apple pie filling) were cold.  I didn't bring this up to her since I didn't wanna make it a big deal, but the mixture of nice, fluffy, warm pancakes in your mouth & then cold apples didn't go so well.  Otherwise I was in and out quickly right before closing time ready to go after a full meal.

data.title: Friendly energetic staff
data.text: Good homestyle cooking, try the Johnnie Cakes, breakfast is served all day, haven't tried anything that wasn't good old home style cooking.

data.title: Don't ask/Don't tell
data.text:
On Saturday, March 29, 2015 My family and I went out to breakfast just as we do every Saturaday as a tradition. We try out new places in the Antelope Valley all the time, just to get some variety and good eats. This time my sister suggested we try AM Cafe. My first impression as we walked in was noticing that "at home" feel and how warm and friendly the waitresses are. They shouted out, "sit whereever you'd like"......Wow..this was going to be good experience, I could just feel it. (Skip to me receiving my food, I ordered the AM omelet and asked for double sausage instead of bacon and sausage). Wow...looks good, I dug right in! Right away I noticed a freezer burn taste and a slighly racid taste. I ignored it at first thinking it was just that piece, so I keep going cause I'm greedy and hungry and then by the third bite, I can't help it, I had to stop eating, it was just that bad. After the waitress asked if I'd like a to-go container, I politely let her know how it taste and she said, "hummm we don't freeze anything" and I responded, "I don't know what it could be." Then I think she apologized, not sure but she did offer to take my order off the bill, I agreed with no further discussion.

Now here goes the disappointment: After receiving the bill, I noticed the waitress didn't take the meal off as she said. When I pointed this out to her, she said she had to get the manager/owner cause she didn't know???? Know "what" I thought,   but I didn't question it. When the owner MIKE came back, he just stood there and looked, in a "can I help you" manner. I explained why I was still standing there waiting and he started shaking his head and saying things like: We made this omelet special for you and .... well everybody else liked their food...i guess I'll just take the loss...he was very upset with me and went on and on...I said, "that's okay, don't take it off if you don't want to" ....then he went on and on again....even showing me on the bill where someome else ordered the same omelet with no complaint (she was later sick, by the way). I repeated and this time insisting...don't take it off. He responded, I already did! All the while shaking his head like I did something wrong, insinuating that I lied..even though the omelet was not eaten, never once apologizing.  Never have I ever experienced such rude behavior and this person was the owner. The waitress was nice and thanked us as we left but the owner did not. I was sooo disappointed and expected better. Hopefull after this review the owner will contact me and apologize for his horrible behavior. If you eat here and you're ASKED how things are tasting ....if your food taste a little off, don't TELL! Just keep it to yourself.

data.title: Old school diner style charm...
data.text:
Old school cafe with breakfast, lunch and dinner but only open till 4.
Greeted with a smile and hello darlin as I entered.  Decor is a mix of mexican and farm roosters.   

Big menu.  I gave waitress power to choose my early lunch...
I got: mexican eggs Benedict. ( change holandayse sauce for salsa & avocado).  Good choice!

It's all so much better than a chain!

data.title: Off the Beaten Path, Right on with the Best Food!!
data.text:
We've been to this restaurant twice before, both times were fantastic!!  Simple decor, reasonably priced food and TERRIFIC quality and Good quantity!!

All three visits were for breakfast and a better selection from walnut banana pancakes or banana bread french toast, all were delicious and wonderfully presented.  Service was good and fairly quick most of the visit.

Became a bit crowded around 9:00am on a Saturday, but still wonderful food and service.  They do have all types of breakfast fare, eggs, bacon, sausage, grits, potatoes, whatever your heart could desire!!!

Will definitely return at every opportunity!!!

data.title: OUTSTANDING breakfast and service
data.text:
We found the AM Cafe on Trip Advisor and after reading so many great reviewds we gave it a try.  Sure glad we did.  The outside looks like an older Mexican restaurant, but in this case, looks do not do it justice.  The menu is all American with a good Mexican flare.  The omlet I had was just about the best I have ever had.  I asked for a few 'extra' things in it and they made it just right.  The country gravy was full of sausage and was as good as I make at home.  Prices were very much in line and the service was off the hook.

Give this cafe a try when you are out and about in Lancaster.  You be coming back I am sure.

data.title: Will go there again!
data.text: Took my husband to breakfast this morning because a friend told me about the place and how she enjoyed her breakfast there. She, nor I enjoy going out to breakfast but my husband does so I decided to take him out for a change. He loved the decision. They moved into what used to be a Mexican restaurant and added a country décor. It is a mom and pop café, which we appreciate. Now comes the good part, the breakfast menu, pancakes, crepes, different dishes and if it is not on the menu they still try to fit your needs. I ordered breakfast with nutty grain pancakes and they were so good. They have several different nuts, seeds and grains in these pancakes. Very healthy I would guess. I plan to go back and get crepes. They show quite a selection of crepes. We both enjoyed our breakfast. Such a selection that I want to go back one day for lunch. Very clean and friendly. Not expensive.

data.title: sweet
data.text: good food and great prices..looking for a nice breakfast then this is a place to go..all of your choices will be good.

data.title: Excellent breakfast
data.text:
This place was voted best cafe in the Antelope Valley and we discovered why this morning. The wife had seen the "Best of" results in the paper a while back and we went looking for the place this morning. Found it in the site of a Mexican restaurant we had visited years past. The decor is a carry over from the Mexican days and provides a nice roomy and comfortable ambience.

The menu was extremely varied, offering an untolled variety of pancakes, three different kinds of home made variety breads as sides to entres, and an entre selection to please just about everyone. I had the "Mexican eggs Benedict" and found them delightful even though the eggs we a touch over poached for my taste. The Canadian bacon was a nicely cut piece with some heft to it, not just a suggestion of meat we so often find in Benedicts. The wife's oatmeal and fresh fruit were offered up in very large portion, enough so that we wound up taking fruit home. 

In all an excellent dining experience and we will be back.

Thanks to Sandra for attentive but unintrusive service.

data.title: Delightful
data.text: A great place to eat breakfast, Mike and his staff are awesome. Food was hot and fresh! Coffee always full cup. The jeffrey loves this place.

data.title: Great find!!!
data.text: This place is the most delightful little place! The breakfast is delicious and the service is awesome!! We are Aussies on a road trip and were treated like locals!

data.title: Awesome for breakfast!
data.text: I wasn't too sure of what I would experience because of the location. I was super happy I gave it a chance. Once you enter, the colors and decorations make you comfortable. The portions were very generous. The staff were nice and I could tell that they take the time to get to know their regulars. There were so many options to choose from so I'll be back for more!

data.title: Not the same
data.text: We loved the old AM Cafe.  But not only did they move, the owners changed, the food selection and amount got smaller, and the coffee is not good.  The potatoes were cold and crunchy, which we were there for breakfast.
